channel.title: Chosing a Linux Distribution
channel.description: First reply containing an actual Linux distribution (providing a link would be nice) will be installed on my laptop.

item.title: Chosing a Linux Distribution
item.dc:creator: @cumescape cumescape
item.description:
@cumescape wrote:

[quote=“zachera, post:4, topic:391089”]This has taken me way too long to complete, and I need to get a distribution on my laptop by the end of the weekend. I don’t have time to go over every single nit-picky feature. Maybe another time.[/quote]I gave you another option to Gentoo… There is no reason to lie in your thread, you said first reply gets it.

Read full topic

item.title: Chosing a Linux Distribution
item.dc:creator: @z z
item.description:
@z wrote:

[quote=“cumescape, post:2, topic:391089”]http://distfiles.gentoo.org/releases/x86/autobuilds/current-iso/

or

http://cdimage.gnewsense.org/gnewsense-livecd-deltah-i386-2.3.iso

I want a scrot when you are done installing it.[/quote]This has taken me way too long to complete, and I need to get a distribution on my laptop by the end of the weekend. I don’t have time to go over every single nit-picky feature. Maybe another time.

[quote=“eczema3, post:3, topic:391089”]http://www.zegeniestudios.net/ldc/

you should take this test.[/quote]Arch it is. Thanks.

Read full topic
